text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

text: The older I get, the greater power I seem to have to help the world.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: Aging is not 'lost youth' but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
author: Betty Friedan

text: The afternoon knows what the morning never suspected.
author: Robert Frost

text: Don't regret growing older. It's a privilege denied to many.
author: Anonymous

text: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

text: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
author: Fred Astaire

text: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.
author: William Penn

text: At 20, we worry about what others think of us. At 40, we don't care what they think. At 60, we discover they haven't been thinking about us at all.
author: Ann Landers

text: The beauty that addresses itself to the eyes is only the spell of the moment.
author: Honor√© de Balzac

text: You can't help getting older, but you don't have to get old.
author: George Burns

text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: Old age is the most unexpected of all the things that happen to a man.
author: Leon Trotsky

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Age is strictly a case of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
author: Jack Benny

text: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals.
author: Samuel Ullman

text: The afternoon of human life must also have a significance of its own.
author: Carl Jung

text: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you're aboard, there's nothing you can do.
author: Golda Meir

text: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

text: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H.L. Mencken

text: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
author: John Barrymore

text: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
author: Pericles

text: To be seventy years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be forty years old.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

text: The years teach much which the days never know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Grow old along with me! The best is yet to be.
author: Robert Browning

text: Old age: the crown of life, our play's last act.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time' is like saying 'I don't want to.'
author: Lao Tzu

text: The first forty years of life give us the text; the next thirty supply the commentary.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: No one is so old as to think they cannot live one more year.
author: Cicero

text: Age appears to be best in four things: old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Time is a brisk wind, for each hour it brings something new.
author: Paracelsus

text: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
author: Satchel Paige

text: The longer I live, the more I realize the impact of attitude on life.
author: Charles Swindoll

text: Time is the moving image of eternity.
author: Plato

text: Old age is fifteen years older than I am.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

text: Years wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
author: Samuel Ullman

text: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
author: Delmore Schwartz

text: The aging process has you firmly in its grasp if you never get the urge to throw a snowball.
author: Doug Larson

text: Time is the most undefinable yet paradoxical of things; the past is gone, the future is not come, and the present becomes the past even while we attempt to define it.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: When I was young I was amazed at how adults could sit for hours without talking. Now I'm older and I know. 'Tired' is a conversation.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
author: Faith Baldwin

text: Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternative.
author: Maurice Chevalier

text: The clock talked loud. I threw it away, it scared me what it talked.
author: Tillie Olsen

text: Age considers; youth ventures.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: Time is a river which sweeps me along, but I am the river.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

text: Aging gracefully is about accepting the passage of time and the beauty of each stage.
author: Cindy Crawford

text: Time you enjoyed wasting was not wasted.
author: John Lennon

text: The older I get, the more I see that there is no end to learning.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Time is what keeps everything from happening at once.
author: Ray Cummings

text: The heart that loves is always young.
author: Greek Proverb

text: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
author: Hector Berlioz

text: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

text: The great advantage of being eighty is that one can take a longer view.
author: Dame Freya Stark

text: Time is a storm in which we are all lost.
author: William Carlos Williams

text: You can't turn back the clock. But you can wind it up again.
author: Bonnie Prudden

text: The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: Old age is like climbing a mountain. You climb from ledge to ledge. The higher you get, the more tired and breathless you become, but your views become more extensive.
author: Ingmar Bergman

text: Time is a circus, always packing up and moving away.
author: Ben Hecht

text: At fifty, everyone has the face he deserves.
author: George Orwell

text: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: The older I get, the more I realize that the greatest luxury is time.
author: Michael Kors

text: Time is a sandpile we run our fingers in.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: Age is opportunity no less than youth itself, though in another dress.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: Time is the devourer of all things.
author: Ovid

text: Old age is the verdict of life.
author: Amelia E. Barr

text: Time is a game played beautifully by children.
author: Heraclitus

text: The afternoon of life is just as full of meaning as the morning; only, its meaning and purpose are different.
author: Carl Jung

text: Time is the substance from which I am made. Time is a river which carries me along, but I am the river.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

text: Age is not important unless you're a cheese.
author: Helen Hayes

text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Diogenes

text: The comfort of being old is that you can say what you think.
author: John Ruskin

text: Time is the fairest and toughest judge.
author: Edgar Quinet

text: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you're aboard, there's nothing you can do.
author: Golda Meir

text: Time is the moving image of eternity.
author: Plato

text: Age is a high price to pay for maturity.
author: Tom Stoppard

text: Time is a storm in which we are all lost.
author: William Carlos Williams

text: The older I grow, the more I listen to people who don't talk much.
author: Germain G. Glidden

text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: One of the many things nobody ever tells you about middle age is that it's such a nice change from being young.
author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

text: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
author: Delmore Schwartz

text: The older I get, the more I believe that the greatest kindness is acceptance.
author: George Burns

text: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
author: Faith Baldwin

text: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Time is a river that flows through the universe, and we are but leaves upon its surface.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The great thing about getting older is that you become more mellow.
author: Julie Andrews

text: Time is the most undefinable yet paradoxical of things.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
author: Mark Twain

text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time' is like saying 'I don't want to.'
author: Lao Tzu

text: Old age is the most unexpected of all the things that happen to a man.
author: Leon Trotsky

text: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

author: Arthur Schopenhauer

author: Pericles
